p: Among the Gram-positive bacteria, the strain belonging to E. faecalis was the most sensitive, followed by S. aureus ATCC 6538, whereas L. monocytogenes NCTC 11994 was the most resistant. Among the species belonging to the Candida genus, C. albicans was the most sensitive and C. glabrata was the most resistant to the tested laurel leaf EOs. Also, P. aeruginosa and P. fluorescens were resistant to the tested EO samples. S. flexneri and K. pneumoniae were resistant to the EOs. Overall, the Gram-positive bacteria and yeasts were more sensitive to the tested EOs in comparison with the Gram-negative bacteria, which is in agreement previous reports ( Griffin et al., 1999).
